instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन |
तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप ||४-५||

Transliteration:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
bahūni me vyatītāni janmāni tava cārjuna .
tānyahaṃ veda sarvāṇi na tvaṃ vettha parantapa ||4-5||
output: 4.5 The Blessed Lord said  Many births of Mine have passed as well as of thine, O Arjuna; I know them all but thou knowest not, O Parantapa (scorcher of foes).

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः |
अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः ||१०-२||

Transliteration:
na me viduḥ suragaṇāḥ prabhavaṃ na maharṣayaḥ .
ahamādirhi devānāṃ maharṣīṇāṃ ca sarvaśaḥ ||10-2||
output: 10.2 Neither the hosts of the gods nor the great sages know My origin; for in every way I am the source of all the gods and the great sages.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अर्जुन उवाच |
दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन |
इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः ||११-५१||

Transliteration:
arjuna uvāca .
dṛṣṭvedaṃ mānuṣaṃ rūpaṃ tava saumyaṃ janārdana .
idānīmasmi saṃvṛttaḥ sacetāḥ prakṛtiṃ gataḥ ||11-51||
output: 11.51 Arjuna said  Having seen this Thy gentle human form, O Krishna, now I am composed and am restored to my own nature.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् |
परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम् ||१८-४४||

Transliteration:
kṛṣigaurakṣyavāṇijyaṃ vaiśyakarma svabhāvajam .
paricaryātmakaṃ karma śūdrasyāpi svabhāvajam ||18-44||
output: 18.44 Agriculture, cattle-rearing and trade are the duties of the Vaisya (merchant), born of (their own) nature; and action consisting of service is the duty of the Sudra (servant-class), born of (their own) nature.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम् |
परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम् ||१८-३८||

Transliteration:
viṣayendriyasaṃyogādyattadagre.amṛtopamam .
pariṇāme viṣamiva tatsukhaṃ rājasaṃ smṛtam ||18-38||
output: 18.38 That happiness which arises from the contact of the sense-organs with the objects, which is at first like nectar, and in the end like poison  that is declared to be Rajasic.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम् |
नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ||२-५७||

Transliteration:
yaḥ sarvatrānabhisnehastattatprāpya śubhāśubham .
nābhinandati na dveṣṭi tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā ||2-57||
output: 2.57 He who is everywhere without attachment, on meeting with anything good or bad, who neither rejoices not hastes, his wisdom is fixed.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति |
भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया ||१८-६१||

Transliteration:
īśvaraḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ hṛddeśe.arjuna tiṣṭhati .
bhrāmayansarvabhūtāni yantrārūḍhāni māyayā ||18-61||
output: 18.61 The Lord dwells in the hearts of all beings, O Arjuna, causing all beings, by His illusive power, to revolve as if mounted on a machine.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महारथाः |
येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम् ||२-३५||

Transliteration:
bhayādraṇāduparataṃ maṃsyante tvāṃ mahārathāḥ .
yeṣāṃ ca tvaṃ bahumato bhūtvā yāsyasi lāghavam ||2-35||
output: 2.35 The great car-warriors will think that thou hast withdrawn from the battle through fear; and thou wilt be lightly held by them who have thought much of thee.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते |
प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः ||७-१७||

Transliteration:
teṣāṃ jñānī nityayukta ekabhaktirviśiṣyate .
priyo hi jñānino.atyarthamahaṃ sa ca mama priyaḥ ||7-17||
output: 7.17 Of them the wise, ever steadfast and devoted to the One, excels (is the best); for I am exceedingly dear to the wise and he is dear to Me.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः |
स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः ||६-१||

Transliteration:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
anāśritaḥ karmaphalaṃ kāryaṃ karma karoti yaḥ .
sa saṃnyāsī ca yogī ca na niragnirna cākriyaḥ ||6-1||
output: 6.1 The Blessed Lord said  He who performs his bounden duty without depending on the fruits of his actions  he is a Sannyasi and a Yogi; not he who is without fire and without action.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
सञ्जय उवाच |
एवमुक्त्वार्जुनः सङ्ख्ये रथोपस्थ उपाविशत् |
विसृज्य सशरं चापं शोकसंविग्नमानसः ||१-४७||

Transliteration:
sañjaya uvāca .
evamuktvārjunaḥ saṅkhye rathopastha upāviśat .
visṛjya saśaraṃ cāpaṃ śokasaṃvignamānasaḥ ||1-47||
output:
1.47. Sanjaya said  Having thus spoken in the midst of the battlefield, Arjuna,
casting away his bow and arrow, sat down on the seat of the chariot with
his mind overwhelmed with sorrow.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अव्यक्तोऽयमचिन्त्योऽयमविकार्योऽयमुच्यते |
तस्मादेवं विदित्वैनं नानुशोचितुमर्हसि ||२-२५||

Transliteration:
avyakto.ayamacintyo.ayamavikāryo.ayamucyate .
tasmādevaṃ viditvainaṃ nānuśocitumarhasi ||2-25||
output: 2.25 This (Self) is said to be unmanifested, unthinkable and unchangeable. Therefore, knowing This to be such, thou shouldst not grieve.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहमेवं यास्यसि पाण्डव |
येन भूतान्यशेषेण द्रक्ष्यस्यात्मन्यथो मयि (var अशेषाणि) ||४-३५||

Transliteration:
yajjñātvā na punarmohamevaṃ yāsyasi pāṇḍava .
yena bhūtānyaśeṣāṇi drakṣyasyātmanyatho mayi ||4-35||
output: 4.35 Knowing ï1thatï1 thou shalt not, O Arjuna, again get deluded like this; and by that thou shalt see all beings in thy Self and also in Me.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः |
कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् ||१६-२१||

Transliteration:
trividhaṃ narakasyedaṃ dvāraṃ nāśanamātmanaḥ .
kāmaḥ krodhastathā lobhastasmādetattrayaṃ tyajet ||16-21||
output: 16.21 Triple is the gate of this hell, destructive of the self  lust, anger and greed; therefore one should abandon these three.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा |
अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् ||९-३३||

Transliteration:
kiṃ punarbrāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣayastathā .
anityamasukhaṃ lokamimaṃ prāpya bhajasva mām ||9-33||
output: 9.33 How much more (easily) then the hold Brahmins and devoted royal saints (attain the goal); having come to this impermanent and unhappy world, do thou worship Me.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः |
यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते ||१८-११||

Transliteration:
na hi dehabhṛtā śakyaṃ tyaktuṃ karmāṇyaśeṣataḥ .
yastu karmaphalatyāgī sa tyāgītyabhidhīyate ||18-11||
output: 18.11 Verily, it is not possible for an embodied being to abandon actions entirely; but he who relinishes the rewards of actions is verily called a man of renunciation.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् |
वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम् ||१८-२१||

Transliteration:
pṛthaktvena tu yajjñānaṃ nānābhāvānpṛthagvidhān .
vetti sarveṣu bhūteṣu tajjñānaṃ viddhi rājasam ||18-21||
output: 18.21 But that knowledge which sees in all beings various entities of distinct kinds as different from one another  know thou that knowledge to be Rajasic.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति |
तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ||७-२१||

Transliteration:
yo yo yāṃ yāṃ tanuṃ bhaktaḥ śraddhayārcitumicchati .
tasya tasyācalāṃ śraddhāṃ tāmeva vidadhāmyaham ||7-21||
output: 7.21 Whatsoever form any devotee desires to worship with faith  that (same) faith of his I make firm and unflinching.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टो
मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनञ्च |
वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो
वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम् ||१५-१५||

Transliteration:
sarvasya cāhaṃ hṛdi sanniviṣṭo mattaḥ smṛtirjñānamapohanañca .
vedaiśca sarvairahameva vedyo vedāntakṛdvedavideva cāham ||15-15||
output: 15.15 And I am seated in the hearts of all; from Me are memory and knowledge, as well as their absence. I am verily That which has to be known by all the Vedas; I am indeed the author of the Vedanta and the knower of the Vedas am I.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानि कथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्ययाम् |
सम्भावितस्य चाकीर्तिर्मरणादतिरिच्यते ||२-३४||

Transliteration:
akīrtiṃ cāpi bhūtāni kathayiṣyanti te.avyayām .
sambhāvitasya cākīrtirmaraṇādatiricyate ||2-34||
output: 2.34 People, too, will recount thy everlasting dishonour; and to one who has been honoured, dishonour is worse than death.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः |
याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ||१०-१६||

Transliteration:
vaktumarhasyaśeṣeṇa divyā hyātmavibhūtayaḥ .
yābhirvibhūtibhirlokānimāṃstvaṃ vyāpya tiṣṭhasi ||10-16||
output: 10.16 Thou shouldst indeed tell, without reserve, of Thy divine glories by which Thou existest, pervading all these worlds. (None else can do so.)

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः |
तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर ||३-९||

Transliteration:
yajñārthātkarmaṇo.anyatra loko.ayaṃ karmabandhanaḥ .
tadarthaṃ karma kaunteya muktasaṅgaḥ samācara ||3-9||
output: 3.9 The world is bound by actions other than those performed for the sake of sacrifice; do thou, therefore, O son of Kunti (Arjuna), perform action for that sake (for sacrifice alone), free from attachment.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते |
स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ||१४-२६||

Transliteration:
māṃ ca yo.avyabhicāreṇa bhaktiyogena sevate .
sa guṇānsamatītyaitānbrahmabhūyāya kalpate ||14-26||
output: 14.26 And he who serves Me with unswerving devotion, he, crossing beyond the alities, is fit for becoming Brahman.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते |
श्रद्धया परयोपेताः ते मे युक्ततमा मताः ||१२-२||

Transliteration:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
mayyāveśya mano ye māṃ nityayuktā upāsate .
śraddhayā parayopetāḥ te me yuktatamā matāḥ ||12-2||
output: 12.2 The Blessed Lord said  Those who, fixing their mind on Me, worship Me, ever steadfast and endowed with supreme faith, are the best in Yoga in My opinion.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् |
यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यताः ||१-४५||

Transliteration:
aho bata mahatpāpaṃ kartuṃ vyavasitā vayam .
yadrājyasukhalobhena hantuṃ svajanamudyatāḥ ||1-45||
output:
1.45. Alas! We are involved in a great sin, in that we are
prepared to kill our kinsmen, through greed for the pleasures of a kingdom.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति |
अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि ||६-३८||

Transliteration:
kaccinnobhayavibhraṣṭaśchinnābhramiva naśyati .
apratiṣṭho mahābāho vimūḍho brahmaṇaḥ pathi ||6-38||
output: Swami Sivananda did not comment on this sloka

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः |
प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ||१७-२४||

Transliteration:
tasmādomityudāhṛtya yajñadānatapaḥkriyāḥ .
pravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṃ brahmavādinām ||17-24||
output: 17.24 Therefore, with the utterance of "Om" are the acts of sacrifice, gift and austerity as enjoined in the scriptures, always begun by the students of Brahman.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते |
एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् ||९-१५||

Transliteration:
jñānayajñena cāpyanye yajanto māmupāsate .
ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā viśvatomukham ||9-15||
output: 9.15 Others also sacrificing with the wisdom-sacrifice worship Me, the All-faced, as one, as distinct, and as manifold.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् |
साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः ||९-३०||

Transliteration:
api cetsudurācāro bhajate māmananyabhāk .
sādhureva sa mantavyaḥ samyagvyavasito hi saḥ ||9-30||
output: 9.30 Even if the most sinful worships Me, with devotion to none else, he too should indeed by regarded as righteous for he has rightly resolved.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला |
समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि ||२-५३||

Transliteration:
śrutivipratipannā te yadā sthāsyati niścalā .
samādhāvacalā buddhistadā yogamavāpsyasi ||2-53||
output: 2.53 When thy intellect, which is perplexed by the Veda text, which thou hast read, shall stand immovable and steady in the Self, then thou shalt attain Self-realisation.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन |
भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ||१०-१८||

Transliteration:
vistareṇātmano yogaṃ vibhūtiṃ ca janārdana .
bhūyaḥ kathaya tṛptirhi śṛṇvato nāsti me.amṛtam ||10-18||
output: 10.18 Tell me again in detail, O Krishna, of Thy Yogic power and glory; for I am not satiated with what I have heard of Thy life-giving and nectar-like speech.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय |
सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते ||२-४८||

Transliteration:
yogasthaḥ kuru karmāṇi saṅgaṃ tyaktvā dhanañjaya .
siddhyasiddhyoḥ samo bhūtvā samatvaṃ yoga ucyate ||2-48||
output: 2.48 Perform action, O Arjuna, being steadfast in Yoga, abandoning attachment and balanced in success and failure. Evenness of mind is called Yoga.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः |
सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम् ||१८-७१||

Transliteration:
śraddhāvānanasūyaśca śṛṇuyādapi yo naraḥ .
so.api muktaḥ śubhā.Nllokānprāpnuyātpuṇyakarmaṇām ||18-71||
output: 18.71 Also the man who hears this, full of faith and free from malice, he, too, liberated, shall attain to the happy worlds of those of righteous deeds.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् |
कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् ||९-७||

Transliteration:
sarvabhūtāni kaunteya prakṛtiṃ yānti māmikām .
kalpakṣaye punastāni kalpādau visṛjāmyaham ||9-7||
output: 9.7 All beings, O Arjuna, go into My Nature at the end of a Kalpa; I send them forth again at the beginning of (the next) Kalpa.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः |
गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः ||५-१७||

Transliteration:
tadbuddhayastadātmānastanniṣṭhāstatparāyaṇāḥ .
gacchantyapunarāvṛttiṃ jñānanirdhūtakalmaṣāḥ ||5-17||
output: 5.17 Their intellect absorbed in That, their self being That, established in That, with That for their supreme goal, they go whence there is no return, their sins dispelled by knowledge.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
तस्मात्त्वमिन्द्रियाण्यादौ नियम्य भरतर्षभ |
पाप्मानं प्रजहि ह्येनं ज्ञानविज्ञाननाशनम् ||३-४१||

Transliteration:
tasmāttvamindriyāṇyādau niyamya bharatarṣabha .
pāpmānaṃ prajahi hyenaṃ jñānavijñānanāśanam ||3-41||
output: 3.41 Therefore, O best of the Bharatas (Arjuna), controlling the senses first, do thou kill this sinful thing, the destroyer of knowledge and realisation.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः |
नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां संन्यासेनाधिगच्छति ||१८-४९||

Transliteration:
asaktabuddhiḥ sarvatra jitātmā vigataspṛhaḥ .
naiṣkarmyasiddhiṃ paramāṃ saṃnyāsenādhigacchati ||18-49||
output: 18.49 He whose intellect is unattached everywhere, who has subdued his self, from whom desire has fled,  he by renunciation, attains the supreme state of freedom from action.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् |
परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ||९-११||

Transliteration:
avajānanti māṃ mūḍhā mānuṣīṃ tanumāśritam .
paraṃ bhāvamajānanto mama bhūtamaheśvaram ||9-11||
output: 9.11 Fools disregard Me, clad in human form, not knowing My higher Being as the great Lord of (all) beings.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज |
अहं त्वा सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः ||१८-६६||

Transliteration:
sarvadharmānparityajya māmekaṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja .
ahaṃ tvāṃ sarvapāpebhyo mokṣyayiṣyāmi mā śucaḥ ||18-66||
output: 18.66 Abandoning all duties, take refuge in Me alone: I will liberate thee from all sins; grieve not.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
एवं परम्पराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदुः |
स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्टः परन्तप ||४-२||

Transliteration:
evaṃ paramparāprāptamimaṃ rājarṣayo viduḥ .
sa kāleneha mahatā yogo naṣṭaḥ parantapa ||4-2||
output: 4.2 This, handed down thus in regular succession, the royal sages knew. This Yoga, by long lapse of time, has been lost here, O Parantapa (burner of the foes).

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम |
नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते ||१-७||

Transliteration:
asmākaṃ tu viśiṣṭā ye tānnibodha dvijottama .
nāyakā mama sainyasya saṃjñārthaṃ tānbravīmi te ||1-7||

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् |
जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ||७-५||

Transliteration:
apareyamitastvanyāṃ prakṛtiṃ viddhi me parām .
jīvabhūtāṃ mahābāho yayedaṃ dhāryate jagat ||7-5||
output: 7.5 This is the inferior Prakriti, O mighty-armed (Arjuna); know thou as different from it My higher Prakriti (Nature), the very life-element, by which this world is upheld.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः |
आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः ||१७-९||

Transliteration:
kaṭvamlalavaṇātyuṣṇatīkṣṇarūkṣavidāhinaḥ .
āhārā rājasasyeṣṭā duḥkhaśokāmayapradāḥ ||17-9||
output: 17.9 The foods that are bitter, sour, saline, excessively hot, pungent, dry and burning, are liked by the Rajasic and are productive of pain, grief and disease.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तं
इच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव |
तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन
सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते ||११-४६||

Transliteration:
kirīṭinaṃ gadinaṃ cakrahastaṃ icchāmi tvāṃ draṣṭumahaṃ tathaiva .
tenaiva rūpeṇa caturbhujena sahasrabāho bhava viśvamūrte ||11-46||
output: 11.46 I desire to see Thee as before, crowned, bearing a mace, with the discus in hand, in Thy former form only, having four arms, O thousand-armed, Cosmic Form (Being).

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते |
आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः ||५-२२||

Transliteration:
ye hi saṃsparśajā bhogā duḥkhayonaya eva te .
ādyantavantaḥ kaunteya na teṣu ramate budhaḥ ||5-22||
output: 5.22 The enjoyments that are born of contacts are only generators of pain, for they have a beginning and an end, O Arjuna; the wise man does not rejoice in them.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं
पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् |
नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं
पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप ||११-१६||

Transliteration:
anekabāhūdaravaktranetraṃ paśyāmi tvāṃ sarvato.anantarūpam .
nāntaṃ na madhyaṃ na punastavādiṃ paśyāmi viśveśvara viśvarūpa ||11-16||
output: 11.16 I see Thee of boundless form on every side with many arms, stomachs, mouths and eyes: neither the end nor the middle nor also the beginning do I see, O Lord of the universe, O Cosmic Form.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः |
भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि ||१८-६९||

Transliteration:
na ca tasmānmanuṣyeṣu kaścinme priyakṛttamaḥ .
bhavitā na ca me tasmādanyaḥ priyataro bhuvi ||18-69||
output: 18.69 Nor is there any among men who does dearer service to Me, nor shall there be another on earth dearer to Me than he.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् |
दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम् ||१८-४३||

Transliteration:
śauryaṃ tejo dhṛtirdākṣyaṃ yuddhe cāpyapalāyanam .
dānamīśvarabhāvaśca kṣātraṃ karma svabhāvajam ||18-43||
output: 18.43 Prowess, splendour, firmness, dexterity and also not fleeing from battle, generosity and lordliness are the duties of the Kshatriyas, born of (their own) nature.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
तस्मादज्ञानसम्भूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मनः |
छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत ||४-४२||

Transliteration:
tasmādajñānasambhūtaṃ hṛtsthaṃ jñānāsinātmanaḥ .
chittvainaṃ saṃśayaṃ yogamātiṣṭhottiṣṭha bhārata ||4-42||
output: 4.42 Therefore with the sword of the knowledge (of the Self) cut asunder the doubt of the self born of ignorance, residing in thy heart, and take refuge in Yoga. Arise, O Arjuna.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च |
अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ||१६-४||

Transliteration:
dambho darpo.abhimānaśca krodhaḥ pāruṣyameva ca .
ajñānaṃ cābhijātasya pārtha sampadamāsurīm ||16-4||
output: 16.4 Hypocrisy, arrogance and self-conceit, anger and also harshness and ignorance, belong to one who is born for a demoniacal state, O Partha (Arjuna).

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत् |
अर्जुन उवाच |
दृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम् ||१-२८||

Transliteration:
kṛpayā parayāviṣṭo viṣīdannidamabravīt .
arjuna uvāca .
dṛṣṭvemaṃ svajanaṃ kṛṣṇa yuyutsuṃ samupasthitam ||1-28||
output: 1.28. Arjuna said  Seeing these, my kinsmen, O krishna, arrayed, eager to fight.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते |
असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||१७-२२||

Transliteration:
adeśakāle yaddānamapātrebhyaśca dīyate .
asatkṛtamavajñātaṃ tattāmasamudāhṛtam ||17-22||
output: 17.22 The gift that is given at a wrong place and time, to unworthy persons, without respect or with insult is declared to be Tamasic.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् |
न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ||१३-२९||

Transliteration:
samaṃ paśyanhi sarvatra samavasthitamīśvaram .
na hinastyātmanātmānaṃ tato yāti parāṃ gatim ||13-29||
output: 13.29 Because he who sees the same Lord eally dwelling everywhere does not destroy the Self by the self; he goes to the highest goal.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः |
अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत् ||६-६||

Transliteration:
bandhurātmātmanastasya yenātmaivātmanā jitaḥ .
anātmanastu śatrutve vartetātmaiva śatruvat ||6-6||
output: 6.6 The Self is the friend of the self of him by whom the self has been conered by the Self, but to the unconered self, this Self stands in the position of an enemy, like an (external) foe.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् |
स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद् ब्रह्मणि स्थितः ||५-२०||

Transliteration:
na prahṛṣyetpriyaṃ prāpya nodvijetprāpya cāpriyam .
sthirabuddhirasammūḍho brahmavid brahmaṇi sthitaḥ ||5-20||
output: 5.20 Resting in Brahman, with steady intellect and undeluded, the knower of Brahman neither rejoiceth on obtaining what is pleasant nor grieveth on obtaining what is unpleasant.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय |
बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणाः फलहेतवः ||२-४९||

Transliteration:
dūreṇa hyavaraṃ karma buddhiyogāddhanañjaya .
buddhau śaraṇamanviccha kṛpaṇāḥ phalahetavaḥ ||2-49||
output: 2.49 Far lower than the Yoga of wisdon is action, O Arjuna. Seek thou refuge in wisdom; wretched are they whose motive is the fruit.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव |
न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे ||१-३१||

Transliteration:
nimittāni ca paśyāmi viparītāni keśava .
na ca śreyo.anupaśyāmi hatvā svajanamāhave ||1-31||
output:
1.31. And I see adverse omens, O Kesava. I do not see any good
in killing my kinsmen in battle.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
येषामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च |
त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च ||१-३३||

Transliteration:
yeṣāmarthe kāṅkṣitaṃ no rājyaṃ bhogāḥ sukhāni ca .
ta ime.avasthitā yuddhe prāṇāṃstyaktvā dhanāni ca ||1-33||
output:
1.33. Those for whose sake we desire kingdom, enjoyments and pleasures,
stand here in battle, having renounced life and wealth.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्य-
मनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् |
पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं
स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम् ||११-१९||

Transliteration:
anādimadhyāntamanantavīryam anantabāhuṃ śaśisūryanetram .
paśyāmi tvāṃ dīptahutāśavaktraṃ svatejasā viśvamidaṃ tapantam ||11-19||
output: 11.19 I see Thee without beginning, middle or end, infinite in power, of endless arms, the sun and the moon being Thy eyes, the burning fire Thy mouth, heating the whole universe with Thy radiance.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् |
उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ||१७-१०||

Transliteration:
yātayāmaṃ gatarasaṃ pūti paryuṣitaṃ ca yat .
ucchiṣṭamapi cāmedhyaṃ bhojanaṃ tāmasapriyam ||17-10||
output: 17.10 That which is state, tasteless, putrid, rotten, refuse and impure, is the food liked by the Tamasic.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
कामात्मानः स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम् |
क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति ||२-४३||

Transliteration:
kāmātmānaḥ svargaparā janmakarmaphalapradām .
kriyāviśeṣabahulāṃ bhogaiśvaryagatiṃ prati ||2-43||
output: 2.43 Full of desires, having heaven as their goal, (they utter speech which is directed to ends) leading to new births as the result of their works, and prescribe various methods abounding in specific actions, for the attainment of pleasure and power.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
शरीरं यदवाप्नोति यच्चाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वरः |
गृहीत्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात् ||१५-८||

Transliteration:
śarīraṃ yadavāpnoti yaccāpyutkrāmatīśvaraḥ .
gṛhitvaitāni saṃyāti vāyurgandhānivāśayāt ||15-8||
output: 15.8 When the Lord (as the individual soul) obtains a body and when He leaves it, He takes these and goes (with them) as the wind takes the scents from their seats (flowers, etc.).

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः |
ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः ||१८-७०||

Transliteration:
adhyeṣyate ca ya imaṃ dharmyaṃ saṃvādamāvayoḥ .
jñānayajñena tenāhamiṣṭaḥ syāmiti me matiḥ ||18-70||
output: 18.70 And he who will study this sacred dialogue of ours, by him I shall have been worshipped by the sacrifice of wisdom,  such is My conviction.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः |
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ||२-५८||

Transliteration:
yadā saṃharate cāyaṃ kūrmo.aṅgānīva sarvaśaḥ .
indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyastasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā ||2-58||
output: 2.58 When, like the tortoise which withdraws on all sides its limbs, he withdraws his senses from the sense-objects, then his wisdom becomes steady.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम् |
सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमाः प्रजाः ||३-२४||

Transliteration:
utsīdeyurime lokā na kuryāṃ karma cedaham .
saṅkarasya ca kartā syāmupahanyāmimāḥ prajāḥ ||3-24||
output: 3.24 These worlds would perish if I did not perform action; I should be the author of confusion of castes and destruction of these beings.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः |
छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः ||५-२५||

Transliteration:
labhante brahmanirvāṇamṛṣayaḥ kṣīṇakalmaṣāḥ .
chinnadvaidhā yatātmānaḥ sarvabhūtahite ratāḥ ||5-25||
output: 5.25 The sages (Rishis) obtain absolute freedom or Moksha  they whose sins have been destroyed, whose dualities (perception of dualities or experience of the pairs of opposites) are torn asunder, who are self-controlled, and intent on the welfare of all beings.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते |
निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा ||६-१८||

Transliteration:
yadā viniyataṃ cittamātmanyevāvatiṣṭhate .
niḥspṛhaḥ sarvakāmebhyo yukta ityucyate tadā ||6-18||
output: 6.18 When the perfectly controlled mind rests in the Self only, free from longing for all the objects of desires, then it is said, 'He is united'.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः |
यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ||७-२||

Transliteration:
jñānaṃ te.ahaṃ savijñānamidaṃ vakṣyāmyaśeṣataḥ .
yajjñātvā neha bhūyo.anyajjñātavyamavaśiṣyate ||7-2||
output: 7.2 I shall declare to thee in full this knowledge combined with realisation, after knowing which nothing more here remains to be known.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान्पार्थः पितॄनथ पितामहान् |
आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातॄन्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा ||१-२६||

Transliteration:
tatrāpaśyatsthitānpārthaḥ pitṝnatha pitāmahān .
ācāryānmātulānbhrātṛnputrānpautrānsakhīṃstathā ||1-26||
output:
1.26. Then, Arjuna (son of Pritha) saw there (in the armies) stationed,
fathers and grandfathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons
and friends too.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः |
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ||२-६८||

Transliteration:
tasmādyasya mahābāho nigṛhītāni sarvaśaḥ .
indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyastasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā ||2-68||
output: 2.68 Therefore, O mighty-armed Arjuna, his knowledge is steady whose senses are completely restrained from sense-objects.

instruction: Explain the meaning of the following Bhagavad Gita verse in simple, modern English. Keep the explanation concise (2-4 sentences) and mention any key context if relevant.
input:
Original (Sanskrit):
अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसावृता |
सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी ||१८-३२||

Transliteration:
adharmaṃ dharmamiti yā manyate tamasāvṛtā .
sarvārthānviparītāṃśca buddhiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī ||18-32||
output: 18.32 That, which, enveloped in darkness, sees Adharma as Dharma and all things perverted  that intellect, O Arjuna, is Tamasic (dark).
